name: Constantinou Bros Pioneer Beach Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel from the 27th may to 8th june2009 on a bed and breakfast basis, We were initially a little apprehensive as we had read some of the disappointing reviews.We arrived late in the evening to be met by a very helpful and pleasant female hotel receptionist ,who was chatty and give us all the information we requested with a  smile. This was the standard throughout our holiday, our luggage was taken immediately by the porter to our room 159 which was very comfortable with all the amenities,the room was spotless, the beds were very comfortable and  the bathroom facilities was excellent, there was the added comforts of towelling robes and slippers the later you were allowed to keep.We paid an additional £198 for a sea view £9 per person per night,our room was a side sea view over looking the pool and across to the beach and sea, we were expecting full sea view,we were told by other clientsstaying at the hotel the tarriff for side sea view was only £5 per night,we were told by the hotel reception we had to persue this with the tour operator Thomson.   We actually liked our room and decided to enjoy our holiday.This hotel is a  well organised and efficiently run hotel,The staff were lovely and very helpful and friendly, The manager sets the standards he is around during the day checking all areas of the hotel and making sure all is running well and guests are happy.A lovely man. The food was excellent.Breakfast was an array of choices, crepes and scotch pancakes with honey and yogurt prepared in front of you with  fried eggs and omelettes,the next section was the full english breakfast  with bacon cooked in front of you ,a variety of cereals,breads, jams, honey, cheeses , meats,cake,and  fruits everthing to make a very enjoyable start to the day, on a sunday morning you were welcomed into the breakfast room with a glass of champagne.  Lunch time we ate at the Captain Cook Pool Bar, and the Regina restaurant next to the pool area, the food was lovely ,salads, toasties, baked potatoes, various hot meals  and on alternative days a chef cook on a spit ,chicken, pork,  to make sovalokia in  large hot pitta breads reasonably priced, At 2pm strawberrys and cream and strawberry tarts were served at the reasonable price of 5.50 euros. Lush.The staff  in all these areas were lovely and helpful and very friendly.We were offered half board at 14euros per person per night  we did try the reastaurant in the evening which was very good  with lots of choice including a carvery,but part of our holiday is eating out which we really enjoy.We found a lovely italian restaurant called the Cavallini 15 minute walk from the hotel on Poseidonas Avenue, it was a bit pricey but the food was superb with fresh vegetables,the stasff were lovely.We also tried the Fiesta which was 15 mins walk from the hotel on the opposite side to the cavallini the food was good and more reasonably priced.We ate in restaraunts and snack bars in paphos harbour area but we were bitten to death by mosquitos even though we had  sprayed ourselves with protective, so be warned. The Hotel had a nightly entertainments programme organised and we enjoyed cocktails of the day at half price between 6pm and 7pm  in the Marco Polo bar where the staff were excellent  inparticular Maria  and Petra were really lovely nothing was a trouble we had a lot of laughs with them.During the day there was lots of activities arranged by french Marie who was a  full of fun, she organised Aqua Fitness, French Boules, Darts,  quiz night, bingo and table tennis.In conclusion we had such a good time we are planning to return to the same hotel next year,
reviews.title: Relaxing holiday in a brilliant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from 2 weeks at the Pioneer beach. I was concerned before we went at the comments about the hotel being built next door, yes this is happening, but in 2 weeks I did not hear a thing not in the mornings or sitting round the pool in the afternoon. We went on HB option, the breakfasts are lovely and served until a reasonable time, dinner is pretty much the same every evening apart from the Greek/Cyprus night which is much better, but not bad for the rest of the time, we tended to eat out some night so we didn't feel we were always eating the same food.
reviews.title: Wonderfully relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are a little dated but clean and tidy. All in all a good place to stay and will return if we go back to Cyprus.
reviews.title: Wonderful Relaxing Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just got back and found this to be a lovely hotel and couldn't understand some of the negative comments it has received and feel it dosen't deserve.
reviews.title: great holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was spotlessly clean, the choice of food was wonderful and the staff friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Half Board Offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful adult only hotel right on the beach, very friendly staff, wonderful choice of food and good all round entertainment. My only wish is that the evening entertainment had started and finished a little later. (no time to go evening shopping without missing the entertainment, it was too hot to shop in the afternoon & most of the proper shops closed for the afternoon).
reviews.title: Pure Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had read several reviews of this hotel after we booked our holiday which gave us concern. However this is one of the best run hotels I have stayed in. I cannot understand people giving this hotel negative feedback , they must be so demanding. All the staff were very helpful and polite.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms and bathrooms were spotless , a nice size room with everything you needed including iron, ironing board , tea and coffee making facilities.
reviews.title: Excellent and Quality Hotel.

reviews.text: The food is wonderful, a brilliant choice, and the staff make such an effort , setting tables outside for the barbeque nights. The entertainment is varied and ok it may not be to your taste every night but there are bars near by which sometimes also have entertainment on.
reviews.title: Child free bliss.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The age varies from people in their twenties upwards, this is an adult only hotel and I must say after visiting a hotel further down the road which was full of families - you could tell the difference, it was wounderful - we ve done that and dont have to do it any more ! lol.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for a relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel, staff work very hard and are so friendly, cheerful and efficient!
reviews.title: The staff are faultless, fab holiday :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was comfy and we got the double bed we'd requested. Air conditioning was much needed and worked well. Breakfast was all you could ask for and served til 10, so you got chance for a bit of a lie in. We always got beds near the pool/beach and they were very comfy and came with a sunshade. Food and drink in the hotel was quite expensive but of good quality (buy drinks in the happy hours!). Local bus service was easy to use, with a set fare, timetables and maps given free at reception. The Meze Corner restaurant was a great place to eat 10 mins up the road if you want authentic food. The Harbour restaurant near the harbour was also very good for lunch or dinner, it had air con in the evening. The child free aspect of the holiday added a serenity and peace that's hard to describe, it really was a wonderful relaxing break. Our only complaints were the shower kept going hot & cold of its own accord and the courtesy room was a vile small hot sweaty shower room, no bench or seat, no ventilation/ air con etc, you needed a shower when you got out of there!! awful! so if you can afford to pay for your room to be extended then do so. Overall a fab hotel, we would certainly consider returning to.
reviews.title: The best holiday experience yet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Pioneer for 11 days in july on b&b basis, but when we got there we were upgraded to hb for free. First impressions of the hotel when we first walked in was a very good one, after a long flight we were checked in very quickly and given the key to our room. The room was spotless, and we had a bottle of water and a basket of fruit in our room when we arrived. At breakfast there was lots of variety to choose from, and the staff were all very friendly and helpful, although don't put your knife and fork down to quickly as they are quick to take things away as soon as the last bit of food goes into your mouth. During our stay at the pioneer we noticed you had to be up before the birds if you wanted to get a sunbed so that meant we were up before 6am most days. There was lots to do throughout the day. Marie as we soon learnt got everyone involved with different activities like, aqua fitness, pool, darts and french boules. She was lovely and would always make sure everyone had a good time. There was a variety of age ranges from 18 through to 80. Everyone we met was very friendly and the atmosphere was so relaxed you could really enjoy yourself with no screaming kids or the noise of a lad's holiday. In the evening again the food was varied, with lots of different things to choose from, the chef was very helpful as myself I have a nut allergy came out every evening and showed me what contained nuts. The only gripe was that the men had to wear long trousers, which my partner didn't realise until we got there this meant we had to go out and buy some more from town.The staff did their best to meet your every need and they couldn't do enough for you. There was lots of different entertainment on in the evening, and if it wasn't your thing then you could take a wonder down to the harbour where you would find lots of other things going on in paphos. I would certainly return to this hotel in the not so distant future, and would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a relaxing holiday which they will never forget.
reviews.title: recommended
Very enjoyable and relaxing week
reviews.text: just returned from a week at the Pioneer and although some have commented that it has an older clientele, I saw a range of ages from 20s upwards. Food was a highlight and there was a great choice at breakfast and dinner. I found all the staff to be helpful, pleasant and attentive. All areas of the hotel were clean and well cared for. The hotel is not in the centre of Paphos but I enjoyed the peace and quiet. The Pioneer sun lounger area is right beside the sea and a paved walk-way leads all the way to the harbour. Buses are 1.50 euros and run every 10 minutes during the day. Taxis are plentiful. The hop-on, hop-off open topped bus (12.50 euros for 24 hours) is a good idea to see the sights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only gripe is about the selfish people who get up before breakfast to place towels on
reviews.title: Overall good but not a 4star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is difficult to fault the Pioneer Beach Hotel. It is very comfortable and efficiently run - pleasant and helpful staff, very good quality and choice of food, extremely clean. We were there for 2 weeks on B&B, but you can buy the evening buffet, usually 16.50 euros each, but if you buy at least 4 you get them for 14 euros - you can then add as many more as you want at the same price. We finished up having 6 meals and you can take them any day without prior notice. The omelettes and fried eggs at breakfast, done to order, were the best we’ve had anywhere!! Although the bacon was deep fried the end result was excellent. Several reviews referred to the age group at the hotel - although many guests were of “advanced” years we found a good mix from 30s upwards. If you wanted you could join in the dancing classes or outdoor bowls. There is also darts, pool and table tennis. The hotel is child free, but this was not a factor in our choosing the hotel. It had THE best “sundowner” area we have sat in. We thought the drinks were not too expensive - the local cocktail (Brandy Sour) was 3.20 euros, cocktail of the day 4 euros, and other cocktails and spirits (including mixer) 5.90 euros - and the best bit - half price during happy hour (6-7). Near the pool there is a self-service café where hot or cold sandwiches, etc. are made to order. This opens when breakfast finishes, and when it closes in late afternoon snacks are available from the bar - you can eat any time of day.
reviews.title: Relaxing Pioneer Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is about 10 mins. walk to the nearest group of shops and restaurants and about 40 mins. to Paphos harbour. You can walk along the beach past the other hotels, although part way along the walkway was being worked on which meant a diversion back to the road.
reviews.title: Hotel OK but not 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Cyprus and we had been warned that it would be expensive. People who had been before said how much prices had gone up in the past couple of years (conversion to euros last year wouldn’t have helped), but you could still get some good meals at reasonable prices - there were a lot of “offers”. On the way into Paphos we had excellent and reasonably priced food at the Taverna on Meze Corner (10 mins. from hotel), Ocean Basket (20 mins. - superb fish and chips served in a frying pan!! - 5 euros), Viva Cyprus (30 mins. - Cypriot family run - a lunch of 2 main courses and a bottle of wine - 21 euros). Locals ate at these - always a good indication of quality. We also ate at Adelaida - two 3-course meals including perfectly cooked steaks and a bottle of wine for 28 euros - this was rated 3rd best restaurant in Paphos on Tripadvisor.
reviews.title: Much better hotels to stay in !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a very good bus service into Paphos Harbour and beyond up the hill to the shops of the old town (No. 11), where there is a very good market open every day, or to Coral Bay (No. 15). Both routes are fixed price (1.30 euros on No. 11, 1.50 euros on No. 15) and they run every 10-15 mins. including Sundays and holidays, but they stop at 6.30 out of season (November to April). We were told that a couple of years ago they were half the price, but you are never sure whether people are talking about Cyprus pounds or euros. Taxis are very expensive - normally 8 euros minimum. They tend to pull up at bus stops for trade. Just wave them on shouting “too dear” - one did offer to take us for 6 euros (feeling the pinch?), which we took up (still not cheap for a 3 min. ride!!).
reviews.title: Nice comfortable hotel and child free (hurrah) but bit out of way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very relaxing hotel and holiday!!
reviews.title: Nice enough hotel, very friendly and helpful staff but watch the prices!

description: Constantinou Bros Pioneer Beach Hotel is an adult –focused, four star, beachfront hotel in Kato Paphos situated conveniently close to the places of tourist and archaeological interest as well as to restaurants, bars and shops. Parking in the hotel car park is free for guests.This hotel is located 15km away from Paphos International Airport and 140 km from Larnaca International Airport. All the rooms have large balconies with views of the Mediterranean or the surrounding serene landscape, luxury bathrooms featuring bath tub, rain shower and flexible hose shower and floor to ceiling windows, fruit & wine and a bottle of mineral water upon arrival. The Executive One Bedroom Suites and the Superior Deluxe rooms include the use of private cabanas on the beach with seating area and sun beds. Room facilities include among others air conditioning and heating, flat screen LCD satellite TV (26 inch in land view rooms and 32 inch in all other rooms) and radio, fridge, mini bar, hairdryer, scales, make-up/shaving mirror, bathrobes and slippers, safety deposit box, ironing facilities, espresso machine as well as tea and coffee making facilities. Sports and leisure facilities include 1 freshwater swimming pool with Jacuzzi, 1 indoor heated pool with Jacuzzi, indoor and outdoor short mat bowling facilities and outdoor Green Bowls facilities, a floodlit tennis court. In the hotel’s Elixir Spa there is a heated pool, sauna, steam bath, a fully equipped gym and a hairdressing salon. You can also choose from a good choice of professional massages as well as facial and body treatments. Enjoy some fine dining at the hotel’s Restaurants or even a romantic candlelit dinner!
